meanings.definition: Having a skill or talent for doing something well.
meanings.sent1: She is very knacky at solving puzzles.
meanings.sent2: He has a knacky way of fixing things around the house.
meanings.sent3: It was quite knacky how she managed to finish the project so quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her knacky approach to painting made her stand out among the artists.
meanings.sent5: His knacky ability to play the piano left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: Showing a clever or resourceful ability.
meanings.sent1: The knacky inventor created a new gadget that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent2: She came up with a knacky solution to the problem in no time.
meanings.sent3: It was knacky how he managed to escape from the tricky situation.
meanings.sent4: Her knacky thinking outside the box led to great success.
meanings.sent5: His knacky way of negotiating always gets him the best deals.

meanings.definition: A clever or skillful way of doing something.
meanings.sent1: Her knacky in baking delicious cakes is well-known in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: He demonstrated his knacky in handling difficult customers with ease.
meanings.sent3: The magician amazed the audience with his knacky in performing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The artist's knacky in using colors created a masterpiece on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: His knacky in fixing cars made him the go-to person in town.
